title: WOW air to relaunch in December – as a cargo airline
text:
The saga of failed Icelandic carrier WOW air has taken another curious twist, with reports from the country claiming it will return to the skies in December – but will carry cargo rather than passengers.

Once famous for its rock-bottom transatlantic fares, WOW ceased trading in March, leaving thousands of passengers stranded overseas. But it was brought back to life last month by American heiress Michele Ballarin, who announced plans for an October relaunch using two aircraft based in Washington DC.

The launch date has now been pushed back to December, however, and the first services will only carry freight – so fish, not fliers.

According to Icelandic media, Ballarin arrived in the country at the weekend to continue promoting WOW 2.0, but her spokesperson, Gunnar Steinn Pálsson, said the initial flights – between Washington DC and Keflavik – will not carry people. He added that the airline still hopes to eventually offer regular passenger services, as well as new routes from the US to mainland Europe.
